newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines' Ramos may need heart surgery - palace.
newsitem.headline: Philippines' Ramos may need heart surgery - palace.

text.p: Philippines President Fidel Ramos was to undergo a series of medical tests on Monday to determine if he needs heart surgery, the presidential palace said.
Ramos, who was admitted to hospital on Sunday, was not in critical condition, a palace statement said. It said the results of the tests would be known by 9 a.m. (0100 GMT).
"As of now, we cannot confirm yet if the president will have to undergo surgery because he is still being examined," Press Secretary Hector Villanueva said in the statement.
Doctors said on Sunday that Ramos, 68, was admitted to hospital for follow-up checks after he was confined to bed earlier this month for treatment of a throat infection.
But television reports said he was to undergo an angiography test to check on suspected blockages in an artery and could require surgery.
Angiography is an X-ray test which uses an injected opaque dye to show up blocked arteries.
